alert.note: Alert for Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 11:42AM EDT until August 06 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Elliott, Menifee and Rowan. In southeast Kentucky, Morgan. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Frenchburg, Bangor, Zilpo, Yale, Big Woods, Paragon, Lick Fork, Scranton, Pelfrey, Craney, Leisure, Ratlitt, Hamm, Blairs Mills, Sudith, Wagner, Minor, Lytten and Fannin Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
